setup.question: Did the questions Tremaine needed answers to get resolved?
answers: No. He thinks that Miss Carroll is behind this out of spite for Mr. Bram, but he's not quite sure.
No. He still doesn't know where the transmission is coming from.

Text.text: remaine is a cop who is hunting communists. He is searching to find unfaithful cops. Theres not much clarity ln the transmission but there is tons of proof that miss carroll is not out to get bram. Bram is a mysterious town man, he and carroll had an affair 50 years ago. Tremaine (cop) goes back to his town to interview carroll about bram and she protects him."How long has Mr. Bram lived in Elsby?" Miss Carroll looked at him for a long moment. "Will what I tell you be used against him?"

Here we see the history of them two and how Carroll wants to protect Bram.

After this convo, Tremaine sees that carroll is not after bram, saying:

Then the story ends and they still don't know much about bram; but they do know that mrs carroll is not behind it.

The story  (seemingly) ends with a bunch of thugs burning down bram's house. It's very vague the ending, but we do know for sure that caroll is not spiting bram, side from whatever else is happening in this story (which isn't very clear)
Why would tremaine be after bram or miss carroll? and what are the questions that tremaine had?

This entire sotry is very unclear. What we know is that tremaine returns to his hometown to try to find who is sending a transmission to interfere with the feds.

I don't know why bram is suspected, it's not clear.

I can prove that carroll is not out to get bram, but why tremaine suspects bram and his relevance towards this transmission, I have no idea.

Here is the free quote of carroll's and tremaine's interaction.

"There is nothing whatever wrong with my faculties, James," Miss Carroll said calmly. Her voice was still resonant, a deep contralto. Only a faint quaver reflected her age-close to eighty, Tremaine thought, startled.

"I'm flattered you remember me, Miss Carroll," he said.

"I. ..." Tremaine started. He looked at the old lady. "I want some information. This is an important matter. May I rely on your discretion?"

"Of course."

"How long has Mr. Bram lived in Elsby?" Miss Carroll looked at him for a long moment. "Will what I tell you be used against him?"

I always liked Mr. Bram," said Tremaine. "I'm not out to hurt him."

"Mr. Bram came here when I was a young woman. I'm not certain of the year."

"What does he do for a living?"

"I have no idea."
Then she says how she loved bram (above) and then tremaine says shes not out to get him (quoted above). more ev

Ok, it seems you have evidence that would disprove A and I'm fine leaving it there for now. But you haven't provided me a justification for why Tremaine "wouldn't know where the transmission is coming from?"

Please focus on this in your next turn. What is the transmission? Why is this a part of Tremaine's mission? Provide concrete evidence that he doesn't know where it's coming from.

Sure. This entire story is extremely unclear. Note how for both debaters, the option is uncertainty. I don't know exactly what the transmitter is, but it seems that there is a transmission coming that interferes with tremaine who works for DC on a top secret project.





I'll fill in what we do know

You don't have to justify yourself. Just don't hold out on me. I sometimes wonder if I've seen the complete files on this-"

"You've seen all the files! Now I want answers, not questions! I'm warning you, Tremaine. Get that

I need someone to hang!"

This is how it starts. Tremaine goes to his home town to find this transmitter of sorts. He interviews carroll and its clear she's not behind it.

This is how I think it ends (very unclear)

Tremaine meets up with the cops; they enter an abandoned

Then they ask tremaine
"What do you make of it. Jimmy?"

He's not sure. Hull calls bram a communist and a spy (i think?)

And then it legit ends. Can quote the end after. None certainty is in both A and B...
Please quote the end and can you give me a summary of the story start to end?

"Bram's a Commie, is he?" Tremaine said softly. "How'd you find that out, Hull?"

"He's a foreigner, ain't he?" the youth shot back. "Besides, we heard ..."

"What did you hear?"

"They're lookin for the spies."

"Who's looking for spies?"

"Cops."

"Who says so?"

The boy looked directly at Tremaine for an instant, flicked his eyes to the corner of the cell. "Cops was talkin about 'em," he said.

"Spill it, Hull," the policeman said. "Mr. Tremaine hasn't got all night."

"They parked out east of town, on 302, back of the woodlot. They called me over and asked me a bunch of questions. Said I could help 'em get them spies. Wanted to know all about any funny-actin people around hers."

Ok so this is how it ends. No closure.

Summary:

-Treamine deployed to his home town to investigate transmitter
-Tremaine asks old lady jess about bram (suspect we think)
-Jess saya bram is mysterious but bram used to be involved with Carroll and Carroll courted Bram 50 years ago
-Tremaine meets carroll at her house (she's very old now)
-Carroll tells treamine her relationship with bram how he rejected her but she still cares for him and has his bracelet years later
-T says Caroll isnt out for Bram
-Mysterious ending w/ uncertainty
